3: Garghhh—!
Another black data steam bursts out of Ann.
The two data streams converge to form a giant black figure.
Is... Is this me?
We're adding a backup of 'her' personality data to 'Virtual Horizon?'
Well, after all, the most important point of 'Virtual Horizon' is to learn how to control that monster in order to win wars.
I see. Looks like ARU's wish to rule the world isn't staying a mere dream.
Of course. The world will be in the palm of our hand...
I see... I was born from a monster. I'm... also a monster...
Ah—!
The Dark Monster waves its huge claws at the unsuspecting Ann.
But the claws are blocked by a red blade, sending sparks into the air.

2: Lu... Wait, no! The Lotus frame?!

3: Not only was it just the Lotus frame, but rather, all the Constructs in 'Virtual Horizon' are appearing before you. They join forces to resist the monster's attack.
What's going on? They weren't summoned, nor were they ordered here.
Ann recalls that she had, in fact, inadvertently added simple personality modules to the Constructs.
In a sense, Ann is their creator.
You all... chose me?
Although the Constructs remain robotic as ever, they closely guard Ann.
I see... Thank you, everyone... Now, just one last mission remains!
And that is to get you safely out of here!
